title: Designing Educational Screencasts for Academic Libraries: Multimedia Learning Theory-Based Intensive Short Course

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education using VR simulations in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can independently navigate three major digital resources of an academic library: e-books, academic databases, and online lectures.
Learners can evaluate screencasts applying five or more of Mayer’s multimedia learning principles.
Learners can produce a 2-minute educational screencast using smartphone-based editing tools.

resources: Free Screencast Production Apps (Explain Edu, CapCut)
VR Headset Sets (10 Sets, Google Cardboard Compatible)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
